SocketMethods Class Reference

#include <SocketMethods.h>

Inheritance diagram for SocketMethods:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A class that wraps around socket methods Provides a message boundary facility
Unless otherwised noted, a method that returns a bool returns true on success, false on failure This is a class (instead of the more apt abstraction, the namespace) because I want to do stuff like inherit from the CommonAspect Also, I think I like the idea of a delimiter on a per object basis? This is still an open issue in my head though..

bool SocketMethods::getClientSocket (  int &  sock,
string  ip,
int  port,
bool  printDebug
) 
 

Wrapper around connectSocket call (easy-to-remember name) if sock is -1, openSocket is called.

Out parameter that is the client socket. the ip you wish to connect to. Eventually I should add resolution here too, but I don't have any motivation for it yet. the port you which to connect on

bool SocketMethods::getServerSocket (  int &  sock,
int  port,
bool  printDebug
) 
 

Calls bind & listen, and sets up a TCP server socket listening on the given port out param that returns the server socket.

If the parameter passed is -1, this method also calls the openSocket() method to open the socket. the port you want to listen on

bool  printDebug
) 
 

Tells a socket to listen.

int  type,
int  protocol,
bool  printDebug
) 
 

Opens a socket - currently just a wrapper around the POSIX socket() system call.

Parameters:
domain the domain to use. Reference your OS to see what is available
type same as above
protocal more of the same

bool SocketMethods::receive (  int  sock,
string &  message,
bool  printDebug
) 
 

Blocking receive call.

Reads from a socket until a message delimiter is hit, or an error occurs. Eats the message delimiter from the recieve buffer.

Parameters:
servSocket the socket to read from. Not necessarily a server socket.
message the message recieved (return argument)

bool SocketMethods::write (  int  sock,
string  message,
bool  printDebug
) 
 

Writes to the socket.

Adds message delimiter to the socket

Parameters:
servSocket the socket to write to. Does not need to be a server socket.
message the message to send. Delimiter is added to end (so not a const&)
